arts.ttl: Birmingham City player ratings after Klarer and Co repel Wrexham to earn draw
arts.sum: Alfie May got a flick, Ethan Laird might have too, but the decisive touch came from Wrexham midfielder George Dobson. The league leaders recovered from Ollie Rathbone’s early strike to level through an own goal from George Dobson, although a number of Blues players might try to take the credit.

arts.ttl: Chris Davies laments two decisions vs Wrexham and reveals message to Birmingham City players
arts.sum: A scrappy goal which has been credited to Lyndon Dykes cancelled out Ollie Rathbone's early strike for Wrexham and Blues battled hard in the second half to take a point. Firstly, Finnie failed to award a penalty when Dykes' header struck a Wrexham hand inside the box.

arts.ttl: Wrexham and Birmingham draw 1-1 in 'Hollywood derby'
arts.sum: Wrexham is attempting to earn its third straight promotion under the ownership of actors Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney but missed a chance to gain ground on Birmingham, which boasts Tom Brady as a minority shareholder. Wrexham settled for a 1-1 draw with third-division leader Birmingham on Thursday in a match between two clubs with celebrity owners.

arts.ttl: Rob McElhenney pays Birmingham City big compliment after surviving Wrexham test
arts.sum: Rob McElhenney expressed his pride at Wrexham’s draw with League One big-hitters Birmingham City – and proclaimed Blues the best team in the division. The draw leaves Wrexham in third place, five points behind leaders Birmingham having played two games more.

arts.ttl: Wrexham settle for draw in 'Hollywood derby'
arts.sum: Wrexham were forced to settle for a point from their clash with League One leaders Birmingham City on Thursday in a fixture dubbed the "Hollywood derby"
Watch highlights of the Sky Bet League One match between Wrexham and Birmingham.

arts.ttl: Birmingham’s Dykes grabs ‘Hollywood derby’ spotlight to keep Wrexham at bay
arts.athr: Will Unwin at the Racecourse Ground
arts.sum: If Wrexham v Birmingham was the alternative Battle of Britain on Thursday night, it certainly lived up to its billing as the League One promotion chasers played out the scrappiest of draws. Like at Old Trafford, it was a fight between red and blue for supremacy but they cancelled one another out in front of a capacity crowd of 13,237. Ollie Rathbone scored a fine opener from range before Lyndon Dykes just about claimed an equaliser thanks to a deflection to ensure a fair result to leave the teams third and first respectively. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Birmingham take point at Wrexham as ‘Hollywood derby’ ends in stalemate
arts.sum: Ollie Rathbone’s strike for the hosts was cancelled out when Lyndon Dykes’ header went in off Wrexham midfielder George Dobson.

arts.ttl: Birmingham maintain five-point gap in L1 race after draw at Wrexham
arts.sum: Birmingham kept their five-point lead over Wrexham in the League One promotion race after a 1-1 draw.

arts.ttl: Wrexham v Birmingham City TV channel, how to stream and listen on radio to 'Hollywood Derby'
arts.sum: While you can subscribe to NOW TV on a monthly basis, you can also secure a day pass should you choose to watch the game. They'll have it on their Sky Sports Main Event and Sky Sports Football channels, with coverage before the 8pm kick off starting at 7pm.
